author: The Hindu Bureau
title: After Ram Mandir, endeavour is to provide shelter to every Ram Bhakt: Pejawar seer - The Hindu
text:
After the construction of the Ram Mandir for Lord Rama, the endeavour will be to provide shelters to all Ram Bhaktas (devotees) through Rama Rajya Samithis across the country, said Udupi Pejawar Mutt seer Vishwaprasanna Tirtha Swami on Friday, December 29.
The seer, who is a Trustee of Sri Ram Janma Bhoomi Tirth Kshetra Trust, was speaking to reporters here on the sidelines of Vishwesha Namana, a programme to remember his Guru Vishwesha Tirtha Swami, organised by Pradeep Kumar Kalkura through Kalkura Pratishthana.
While there would be no paid sevas at the Ayodhya Ram Mandir, devotees desirous of performing seva to Lord Rama, could do so by providing shelters to devotees of Ram through the Samithis that would be formed in every State, Vishwaprasanna said. The seer said he was already implementing a shelter for the poor scheme in the Udupi district and said devotees could do so through the samithis. Devotion to the nation and devotion to Lord Rama were one and the same, he added.
No politics in inauguration The seer clarified that there was no political connection to the Ram Mandir inauguration. The construction took three years as against the planned two and a half years due to the soil conditions, he added that the inauguration was scheduled though the Mandir was not fully complete.
Everyone, including political parties, was invited for the inauguration. Some political parties have rejected the invitation and talked ill about the Mandir. Such comments would come if you invite them or do not invite them also. There was no discrimination in inviting people while the venue could hold only about 7,000 people.
Entry open Devotees would be allowed inside the temple from January 23, the next day of the inauguration, Vishwaprasanna said. The temple remains open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. while poojas would be done as per the earlier Ramananda cult.

author: Mary Sue Espiritu
title: Ni Ingeniería ni Derecho: MTPE revela cuáles son las profesiones mejor pagadas en Perú | EVAT | Sociedad | La República
text: Estas son las profesiones mejor pagadas en Perú, según el MTPE: sueldos van hasta los S/10.000 El MTPE publicó un estudio sobre las profesiones que son mejor remuneradas en el Perú con el fin de que los estudiantes sepan qué esperar del mercado laboral. [La segunda ciudad más cara de Sudamérica está en Perú: superó a Sao Paulo y Santiago](/mundo/2024/01/04/la-segunda-ciudad-mas-cara-de-sudamerica-esta-en-peru-supero-a-sao-paulo-y-santiago-lima-evat-249516) [¿Cómo comprar productos que rematan Aduanas en enero?: adquiere así laptops, celulares, ropa y más](/economia/2024/01/01/como-comprar-productos-que-remata-la-aduanas-en-enero-adquiere-asi-laptops-celulares-ropa-y-mas-a-precios-bajos-sunat-evat-84826) [Peruano abre Rustika en un cerro de JICAMARCA y Mauricio Diez Canseco le manda un singular mensaje](/tendencias/2023/12/27/peruano-abre-rustika-en-sjl-y-mauricio-diez-canseco-reacciona-a-peculiar-negocio-que-dijo-evat-1354077) Las profesiones desempeñan un papel crucial en el [desarrollo económico y social del Perú](https://larepublica.pe/mundo/2024/01/04/la-segunda-ciudad-mas-cara-de-sudamerica-esta-en-peru-supero-a-sao-paulo-y-santiago-lima-evat-249516). Es por ello que elegir una carrera es importante, pues determina la contribución individual al progreso del país. Los profesionales de diversas áreas, desde la salud hasta la ingeniería y derecho, desempeñan roles fundamentales en este proceso. Mientras tanto, el [Ministerio de Trabajo y Promoción del Empleo (MTPE)](https://larepublica.pe/economia/2024/01/05/aumento-del-sueldo-minimo-2024-en-peru-que-dijo-el-ministro-de-trabajo-sobre-un-posible-incremento-salario-minimo-peru-2024-daniel-maurate-recesion-economica-atmp-366075) se esfuerza para asegurar la equidad y el cumplimiento de derechos laborales, garantizando un entorno laboral justo y sostenible para todos. En esa línea, con el objetivo de conseguir una comprensión más precisa de la demanda laboral en el Perú y su evolución a lo largo de los años, el MTPE ha desarrollado la plataforma web [Mi Carrera](https://micarrera.trabajo.gob.pe/universidades/). Esta herramienta brinda información sobre carreras, instituciones educativas, opciones de financiamiento y becas, por lo que está especialmente diseñada para aquellos que están a punto de concluir la educación secundaria y deseen saber qué rumbo profesional seguir. La profesión mejor pagada en el Perú El portal Mi Carrera no solo brinda datos relevantes sobre las carreras profesionales y opciones educativas, sino que también presenta información actualizada sobre la dinámica del mercado laboral actual. Este análisis se basa en la Planilla Mensual de Pagos (Plame) y el T-Registro de Sunat, y ofrece detalles sobre las carreras más valoradas desde una perspectiva económica. Gracias al informe del MTPE, se han identificado las carreras universitarias mejor remuneradas en el país en el año 2022, con el fin de ofrecer la orientación adecuada a quienes buscan escoger su carrera o evaluar el valor de sus habilidades en el mercado laboral nacional. Medicina es la carrera profesional mejor remunerada en el Perú. Foto: Andina Según la investigación, medicina se posiciona como la profesión mejor pagada en el Perú, con un salario mensual promedio de S/6.745. Los profesionales médicos no perciben salarios inferiores a S/3.564 y, en algunos casos, llegan hasta los 10.000 soles (S/9.175 como máximo, según registros del MTPE). PUEDES VER: [Esta es la universidad pública más prestigiosa de Sudamérica, según la IA: No es UNMSM de Perú ni la UBA de Argentina] ¿Cuáles son las otras profesiones mejor pagadas en el Perú? Dentro de las 10 carreras mejor remuneradas en el Perú, se destacan: Ingeniería Minera, Metalurgia y Petróleo; Ciencias Políticas; Estadística; Agronegocios; Geología; Ciencias de la Computación; Ingeniería de Sistemas y Cómputo; Enfermería; y la Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones. Si quieres ver el listado completo, puedes dar [clic aquí.](https://micarrera.trabajo.gob.pe/universidades/) |N°||Carrera universitaria||Ingreso promedio mensual al mes||Mínimo a máximo| |1||Administración de Empresas||S/3.107||De S/1.211 a S/5.727| |2||Agronegocios||S/2.339||De S/1.150 a S/3.780| |3||Geología||S/4.263||De S/1.725 a S/7.246| |4||Ciencias de la Computación||S/4.208||De S/1.693 a S/7.600| |5||Ingeniería de Sistemas y Cómputo||S/4.170||De S/1.542 a S/7.293| |6||Enfermería||S/4.034||De S/1.800 a S/6.012| |7||Ingeniería Minera, Metalurgia y Petróleo||S/ 3.993||De S/1.600 a S/7.139| |8||Ciencias Políticas||S/ 3.991||De S/1.540 a S/7.000| |9||Estadística||S/ 3.978||De S/1.500 a S/7.042| |10||Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones||S/ 3.942||De S/1.637 a S/6.500| Redactora web en diario La República. Con experiencia en el videoreportaje periodístico sobre temas sociales y de política. Amante de los libros, películas y el anime. Cargando MgId...

author: 中國報
title: 阿根廷首都 大面积停电 | 中國報 China Press
text:
（布宜诺斯艾利斯6日综合电）阿根廷首都布宜诺斯艾利斯发生大面积停电。
布宜诺斯艾利斯市区当地时间5日凌晨发生大规模停电，上午短暂恢复供电后于中午12时50分左右再次停电，致交通信号灯关闭、部分学校停课等。
布宜诺斯艾利斯地铁运营公司表示，所有地铁线路自当天凌晨起都处于中断或变更状态。
阿根廷媒体报道说，首都地区高压线路故障导致当天大面积停电。
文：综合报导
图：互联网

author: Guest
title: Carl Alfred Garber Jr.
text:
Carl Alfred Garber, Jr., went to his heavenly home at the age of 95 on Monday, January 27, 2025. Carl passed away from this world at home surrounded by his daughter, Gail Garber, and his granddaughter, Danielle Garber. Carl was born at home in Kosciusko County, Indiana on December 19, 1929, to Carl Alfred Garber, Sr., and Dessie (Mellott) Garber. He grew up in South Bend, Indiana and graduated from Riley High School in 1948.
Carl also known as Dusty married Judith Mary Troxel on August 17, 1954, in the chapel of Oaklawn Methodist Church in Dallas, Texas. Carl and Judy met on a blind date in South Bend and were engaged at the end of one week. He earned the nickname “Dusty” by blowing dust from his car he picked up during a sandstorm in New Mexico on her white dress on their first date. They were able to share 65 wonderful years together. Judy passed in December of 2019.
After graduating high school, Carl joined the United States Air Force in August of 1950. He served in the Air Force as an Airman First Class during the Korean War until 1954. Carl worked many different jobs throughout his life, including work at the University of Texas Southwestern Medical School as an instrument maker and at LTV. He retired from the U.S. Postal Service after 25 years in 1999. He oversaw heating and air conditioning at the North Texas Mail Processing Center. In his younger years Carl was a Dallas County Reserve Sheriff. He was a 32nd Degree Mason and was a member of Eastern Star. Carl was a past member of the Amateur Radio Relay League in Denton and enjoyed working with computers and amateur radios.
Carl is survived by his two children, Gail Nadine Garber of Denton, Texas and Walter Wilkinson Garber of Temple, Texas; Granddaughters Danielle Judith Garber of Denton, Texas and her fiancé Andrew Paul Savage of Wylie, Texas, and Christian Marie Biddiscombe and her husband Christopher Biddiscombe of California; as well as Sister and Brother-in-law Judy and John Burkhart of Millersville, Maryland. He is preceded in death by his wife, Judy Garber, his brother Ralph Garber, and both of his parents.
A graveside service for the family will be at the Dallas-Fort Worth National Cemetery on Friday, February 7, at 11:30 am. The service will be lead by Pastor Chuck Smith of Reach Church, Denton formerly known as Towne North Baptist Church, where Carl was a member.
The family would like to give a special thank you to Hutcherson Insurance Group and Brian Hutcherson for allowing Gail time to care for her dad at home. The family would also like to thank their Reach Church Denton family for all their love and support this week as well as over the years. Finally, the family thanks VNA Hospice and Nurse Barbara for their compassionate care and guidance this past year.
On line condolences may be made at www.mulkeybowlesmontgomery.com

author: Genevieve St. Clair
title: US Lawmakers Condemn Vandalism of Hindu Temple in California as Possible Hate Crime
text: US Lawmakers Condemn Vandalism of Hindu Temple in California US Lawmakers Unite Against Vandalism of Hindu Temple The recent vandalism of the Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple in Newark, California has sparked strong condemnation from several US lawmakers, including prominent Indian-American Congressmen. The act of vandalism, which included anti-India graffiti, has prompted calls for accountability and unity against bigotry. Community Action Against Hate Congressman Ro Khanna and other lawmakers have emphasized the importance of standing united against acts of intolerance and vandalism. The community’s response to remove the graffiti has been highlighted as an example of answering wickedness with goodness. Call for Swift Action Congressman Shri Thanedar has called for a thorough investigation into the vandalism, emphasizing the fundamental tenets of religious freedom and communal harmony in the nation. Law enforcement has been urged to take swift action to bring the perpetrators to justice and ensure the safety of all places of worship.

organizations.name: possible hate crime us lawmakers condemn vandalism of hindu temple
community action against hate congressman ro khanna
